questions.question: You will have an accident if you ………………. on driving like that.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: ‘The door bell is ringing.’ ‘I …………………..’
questions.description: The simple future is used to announce decisions that are taken at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: I ………………… my parents next week.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: Will it be all right if I …………………….. an extra night?
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: She didn’t get the promotion ………………………. working hard.
questions.description: Before an ing form we use a preposition. In spite of is a preposition.

questions.question: The deer was ……………………. by a car.
questions.description: Stricken is the past participle of strike.

questions.question: Those who know the answer should …………………… their hand.
questions.description: Raise is transitive rise is intransitive.

questions.question: Much water has ………………….. under the bridge.
questions.description: Flown is the past participle is fly. Flowed is the past participle of flow.

questions.question: I had met him before he ……………………. to Germany.
questions.description: Flew is the past participle of fly.

questions.question: The ……………………. men were taken to hospital.
When I reached there, I could see that they …………………..
questions.description: The past perfect is used for the earlier of the two past actions.
